text.0: soma and pūṣan parents of all riches parents of earth and parents of high heaven.
text.1: you twain brought forth as the whole worlds protectors the gods have made centre of life eternal.
text.2: at birth of these two gods all gods are joyful they have caused darkness which we hate to vanish.
text.3: with these with soma and with pūṣan india generates ripe warm milk in the raw milchcows.
text.4: soma and pūṣan urge your chariot hither the sevenwheeled car that measures out the region.
text.5: that stirs not all that moves to every quarter fivereined and harnessed by the thought ye mighty.
text.6: one in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling on earth and in the firmament the other.
text.7: may they disclose to us great store of treasure muchlonged for rich in food source of enjoyment.
text.8: one of you twain is parent of all creatures the other journeys onward allbeholding.
text.9: soma and pūṣan aid my thought with favour with you may we o’ercome in all encounters.
text.10: may pūṣan stir our thought the allimpelling may soma lord of riches grant us riches.
text.11: may aditi the perfect goddess aid us loud may we speak with heroes in assembly.
